title: Chord: 11th in C# (Shape: E)
content:
# Chord: 11th in C# (Shape: E)

## Overview
The 11th chord in the key of C# is often represented using the E shape on the guitar. This chord adds a sense of color and tension to the harmony, making it a popular choice in various musical styles.

## Notes and Intervals
The 11th chord in C# consists of the following notes and their respective intervals:
- Root (C#)
- Major 3rd (E#)
- Perfect 5th (G#)
- Minor 7th (B)
- Major 9th (D#)
- Perfect 11th (F#)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The 11th chord in C# adds a jazzy and sophisticated flavor to music. It is commonly used in jazz, R&B, funk, and fusion genres to create lush and rich harmonic textures. This chord brings a sense of depth and complexity to compositions, making it a favorite among musicians looking to add a modern twist to their sound.

## Songs
Here are three songs that showcase the use of the 11th chord in C# (Shape: E):
1. "So What" by Miles Davis - This jazz classic features the 11th chord extensively, creating a cool and laid-back atmosphere.
2. "Redbone" by Childish Gambino - This modern R&B track utilizes the 11th chord in a funky and soulful manner, adding depth to the harmonic progression.
3. "Josie" by Steely Dan - A fusion masterpiece, this song incorporates the 11th chord to create a sophisticated and groovy sound that is quintessential Steely Dan.
